WRITING.TEXT: I got my P1 on a 2nd try, 1st spin by the McClaren cards no dice, then paid 100G for the 2nd spin, in old event structure you couldn't touch half of it w/o an existing McClaren, and could maybe get only 550 (250 for first win+300 for class cars) cards a day. If you already have cars gt;550PI's more possible. Knowing it's limited time I got greedy and blew 1300G on spins (3rd copy by spin 9 so I was hopeful). Just 1 copy short of 4\* ing it dangit! Still with only 529PI in new McC event I managed to take out the low-end event cars (550 amp;560PI, the 560 was an F1). The launch is twitchy, perfect near impossible but even an overgas your accel is still great, just start out a shade low on the nitro.

I feel like sometimes it pays to miss a perfect corner, to not have to sit on a double boost, at least in races w/ lt;25PI difference. DD 1st corner, if you just missed perfect launch, a double perfect corner gives you double nitro, and that leg feels too short for benefit of a double boost. Bayside having a double boost for the last leg feels useless unless you're pretty tight w/ opp on last turn. That's my least favorite. If I'm not tight on opp bumper or leading in that 3rd turn, I seldom win from behind. Should I sit on a double boost after that turn until mid tunnel? SB I don't double boost 2nd leg unless I get it within a second of exiting the corner. Otherwise I'll blow the single boost, be full up entering leg three (assuming at least great brake amp;gas corner 2), blast near immediately, and by the time you hit turn 3 you're near 1 boost entering the corner, and 1.5-1.9 exiting. Just in general if I feel like I will be gt;1.5 full by the time I enter the next corner, I do a single blast in the first half of the leg (to either close the gap or widen if leading, or shrink my lead less if opp is double boosting from behind me). Short of a late brake/early gas combo, you pick up at least a half boost in a corner, so sitting on the double boost through the whole turn feels a waste.

I got one on 2nd spin, then blew 1400g to get only 3 dupes, 1 short of 4 starring it! Argh. Maybe woulda been better off w/ 1350g of premium cards

WRITING.TITLE: 3* double down - take it if it makes you 4*
WRITING.TEXT: If you ever get a 3\* double down offer for pulling a dupe (not sure if it only happens when you pull a 3\* dupe?), might be worth taking especially if you are at 3.75\* (and the double down would make your car a 4\*). I think I goofed by turning down the offer. I got that offer an a Charger r/T midway thru the spotlight week... at 3.5\*, spun a 3\* charger, and got that offer (400G for another 3\* dupe, 500 3\* chips, and 500 epic chips or something like that). Was thinking, eh, 85G per paid spin plus rack up enough chips to get a spotlight card a day, thought I could easily swing another Charger during the event... unlucky though. 0 for 4 on the spotlight cards, finally got another Charger on the 4th paid card... but 2\*!! Doh! Forgotten that most spotlight cars are 2\* rare. So I would have been better off taking up the double down offer, to have gotten my first 4\* car (rare too). Previously made the same mistake(?) with a retro M3 (also at 3.75\* after a good draw, got the offer, (forgot the price). But I was thinking why do I need my first 4\* as a retro when EP2 is Modern and EP3 is Classic? But a super high PI 4\* of any type would be helpful progressing and dominating unrestricted races. If the double down takes you from 3.5 to 3.75\*, not so sure though. It puts you closer to getting a 4\* car, but I got my Boss 302 to 3\* long before I had a single Charger r/T, but somehow i pulled way more dupes of the latter in the last week or 2, after I had sunk lots of upgrades into the Boss 302. So luck of the draw may have your car that was ahead in dupes leapfrogged when you least expect it.

WRITING.TITLE: Race Database added to ForzaStreet Car rankings page
WRITING.TEXT: Wanted to put some real numbers behind the various opinions on the Best cars ranking sheet kindly put together by leesonreddit so with their permission added a new tab labeled "Race Results Database". [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1uliYI-CDk5NIgJuuyzogk0N2oiKE6zMzyoxRBVAtmzM/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1uliYI-CDk5NIgJuuyzogk0N2oiKE6zMzyoxRBVAtmzM/edit?usp=sharing) Enter your car, PI at the time, track, and runtime (seconds). Looking for sort of average-ish or good times, if you blew the start and all turns, don't bother putting in that run, but if you get a perfect and OK, they kind of cancel out in my current calculation. I'm going off the end of race stats/map listing of FULL perfects (not the rivals mode x25 pts count of half perfects). If you don't remember exactly don't worry, the default assumption is equivalent to straight goods. Also don't really want runs where you were testing boost abstinence, more a "used what you could in a tight race" scenario, even if in reality the opponent was way ahead or way behind, more a kind of time trial indicator. If you also don't know your time beyond tenths of a second, also don't worry. Looking to get a sense of truly vs perceived fast or slow cars, not times to the 0.001 second. For now not distinguishing between story / upgrade / spotlight / rivals / races, although we could add that if someone thinks it makes a difference to YOUR car's time, not the opponent's. Once we get enough entries some kind of average time and PI by track can be put on the front tab so that people can judge. If we get super fancy maybe at some point we normalize it to estimated average time at PI500 or some other way to make it less lopsided if one car has a lot of people with high PIs entering and another with only low PIs. With average PI and average time by track at least though you can see which cars are punching above their PI or below for a given track. Maybe include an average +/- of perfect/OK to also help people qualitatively factor in (especially important if not many entries for the given car/track combo) how good the drivers were behind a particular avg number.

Getting it to 3\* (3 draws of 2\* cards) is more reasonably possible though.

WRITING.TITLE: Wish you could half boost?
WRITING.TEXT: That's one thing I wish they had in ForzaStreet, being able to half boost at will. Yah maybe they want to keep the controls simple, but doesn't seem like it would be too hard to differentiate a double boost, e.g. double tap, or holding on the nitro for longer than a half rotation or something similar. Often I'll be coming in somewhere (DD turn 2) where I know I can't sit on a double nitro until the next turn so I intentionally try and miss the turn timing a bit to avoid getting a full double. Maybe the AI car is similarly crippled, sometimes I see them blasting into a turn, wonder if they're in a similar bind.

WRITING.TITLE: Autogrinder?
WRITING.TEXT: Getting repeated tuneups to get to the next upgrade level is getting to be a drag. Is there any way to set up an autogrinder on phone (or even desktop) to just spam Ep1:1:1 and convert energy into chips (story, ep 1, part 1, event 1, click thru talking heads, select car, start, pick first race, set to level 2, autorace, click next race, click thru talking heads, set level 2, autorace, lather rinse repeat until you're out of energy (or just manually specify number of cycles to run given your energy meter). I can sort of do it half paying attention while watching TV or whatever but that's additional thumb RSI on top of playing #128540; There are probably more options on Windows desktop , if you fullscreen the game, the control locations are more predictable. I remember way back there was a keystroke recorder automator that could handle keystroke shortcuts, for FS I think it would need to be a mouse recorder type thing. I have an Android phone too (Moto X Pure) but dunno if it's too old a generation to handle FS and/or whether there's automation software/apps that would work on that.

If you'll notice off on the right on the database sheet there's a proto pivot table summary of average by car and track (for PI, time, and net perfects) for the data, which should auto update as records are added to the database. Also did a crude scatterplot regression on it (time vs PI) and it fits the general pattern, higher PI = lower time, although there are faster and slower cars within the scatter of data. Clicking on individual points, the ones that fall below the line tend to be ones with more net perfects, so trying to figure a way to convert those into an approximate common metric, to try and isolate good car effect from good driver impact. It won't be exact, but maybe as a first cut, what do y'all think is an average time impact of a full perfect on run time on a typical course. E.g. straight goods, vs straight perfects. Is 0.25 sec each about right (1 sec per race)? It feels like the right ballpark, knowing my course times in good runs vs totally meh ones typically run about a second off give or take.

WRITING.TITLE: Thumb or pointer launch
WRITING.TEXT: Now that I've gotten a P1 I've gone exclusively to pointer/index finger launch instead of thumb. Thumb is much slower, and I just try and work out a rhythm of tapping (Tap Tap Revenge!) that keeps the throttle peaking into or maybe slight thru the green zone. A lot of overgas with the P1 but at least the launch speed is still passable even with that (keeping up/ahead of most cars, just low on starting nitro). Slow start is deadly for a P1 so I try and err high for that car especially. What's your preferred launch technique?

Unless you have Sports amp; Supers w/ high enough PI to dominate the upgrade events it could take a while to get your new McL's competitive (else you win only one part per upgrade day taking the easiest path). My 570s at 514PI might be able to take out the 550PI, but again 560PI is a stretch. Dominating w/ 3 McL's for now is a pipe dream. Maybe in week 5? If you're sitting on a lot of unused sports and super exhausts from prior weeks you could level up faster.

I do like your strategy of working up to the higher levels. If you mess up the low tier with the 570s, go at it w/ your next best, etc. My P1 win last nite allowed my 570s to break its 500PI cap as a 2*

Someone else suggested a well timed thumb mash held down. It will repeatedly bounce after pegging but if you time the initial mash right it #8217;s rebounding thru the green zone. So far I #8217;m 2 over gas and one perfect trying to mash on the max of the 2 countdown. Might try other timings too. I may stick to index finger for less twitchy cars though else you have to remember separate timing for each car. They all react differently on the thumb mash or release whereas the index tap through the countdown you can increase the tap rate to get the peak moving higher or skip a beat if you overshot.

WRITING.TITLE: Intentionally blowing turns
WRITING.TEXT: It started as a way to avoid double nitros in bad spots where you have to use it or lose it (turn 2 DD). There you don #8217;t want to outright miss entirely, but may good or great only on the exit. Then others suggested no lift or half brakes on shallow turns (SB 3, Bay 2) which seems to work well enough if you can sacrifice a half or full boost for position. Wondering now if there are other situations where it makes sense to blow a turn. Bay 1 I didn #8217;t use my perfect launch boost immediately. But was feeling the pressure of the AI car. Sure enough, after my perfect brake, it was squeezing in from left rear. By then i was at 1.9 boosts so said what the hey and immediately early gassed. If I had waited I woulda been pinched to the wall anyway (and usually level w/the AI) but found myself still at the wall, but clear by a length, and felt much better benefit of my double boost. I #8217;ll Another time DD I got stuck w/ a double at turn 2 (missed my not perfect exit and got perfect) so I blasted immediately. I got the inside line on the 3rd corner, 0.9 of a boost after perfect brake, but AI coming fast around outside. Likely no shot at even 2single boosts on that leg, even w/ a perfect gas, So I early gassed, swinging wide, amp; the AI never got to finish its outside pass. Maybe it had double boosted just to catch up and had no boosts left, but too often I have lost despite leading into turn3, so wonder if the sloppy wide swing can sometimes cut off the AI from an outside pass?

I can confirm now the joys of freestyle, rather than trying to nail every turn perfectly, you decide on the fly based on position/speed/opponent. Bayside, midway thru turn 1 w/ a perfect start held boost and perfect brake, you #8217;re at 2 boost. Screw the perfect gas, early gas outta there. Then your double boost will be started clear of and ahead of AI car, not behind. Spotlight 3 taking on a car at +20PI bayside I often lose, but here I was ahead to turn 2 enough to double perfect turn 2, it caught up turn 3, but perf brake left me at 1.9, so I gassed early again to fall behind less, double boosted thru the underpass, and held on post jump. In retrospect maybe shoulda half braked turn 2 to better hold speed and try and nail turn 3, but it worked out ok.

For sure don #8217;t do it on McL or event final unless you failed every other way. Find event race w/ your least fave track and set to level 4 challenge or whatever 10-20ish pi over your level. That #8217;ll mimic a desperation mode level challenge.

Btw on sharp turns don #8217;t do gas too too early else you #8217;ll hit wall /curb /something kinda hard. Maybe if the opponent is ahead outside half to 3/4 length (level with their door/bumper give it a shot, they #8217;ve clipped me often enough. I tried it once while level w/ their front, and I shot past and hit the wall so save the way too early gas moves on sharp turns for desperation moves as they #8217;re almost fully past you. Get past the turn apex at least on sharp turns.

TRY TO ALWAYS FINISH EVENTS WITH 400 CHIPS LEFTOVER. Cards earned in an event are stuck at their Episode odds. So if you #8217;re auto race grinding 1-1-1, 2x300 gets you 1 card + 100chips. 2x200 gets you 400chips, effectively 4/5 of an Ep 3 card. Same for tiers of upgrade events. Eventually you get to the point where you have more upgrade units than CR to install them. Then spam 1-1-2. That episode gets you a card per 300 chips. So autorace top value gives you 3 cards per run there. All? Level3 tuning kits (400unit). And 200-400 CR with that. Most of the time 300CR. Feels like the 200CR comes more often than the 400, but no matter, much closer to balanced tuning unit and CR acquisition there. 300CR/400unit, vs 300CR/3000unit. Yeah it feels like you #8217;re wasting effort for only level3 Kits, but if you #8217;re short on credit, a stockpile of level5 units is also unusable without matching CR. 1-1-2 gets you ~900CR for 7 energy. Don #8217;t think theres anywhere better. 1-1-1 run at 2x200 (to get 400chips) gets you 4/5x300CR =240CR for 3 energy. 1-1-1 at 2x300 = 1card at 200CR, and 1/5 of an Ep3 card (300CR), so 260CR for 3 energy. 520CR for 6 energy is nowhere near 900Cr for 7 energy of spamming 1-1-2. So any time you #8217;re filling up on energy but not having time to commit to an event. You can burn up some energy and get some CR/tuning units in the meantime rather than just leave your energy full. So if I plan a 1hr dinner, I #8217;ll burn off 15 energy with 2 min of auto racing 111 or 112.

tinytask is pretty small, seems to work well enough. click through things at a leisurely pace, in case the timing is a bit off. Then you can set a number of cycle repeats (to use up your total energy). Don't run it when you're attempting to anything else, because it's essentially grabbing mouse and keyboard control every fractional second so you can superquick move it to click something else but might mess up the autoplay (different window in focus, etc) and just be generally annoying. Someone suggested spamming upgrade 1 shortest path instead of Ep111, but not sure if the event geometry is always fixed like the story events are. Fixed position and full windowing FS lets it be pretty precise on where you are clicking. i guess you could record a new one each day but that would be a pain.

WRITING.TITLE: Autorace SPAM efficiency calculator
WRITING.TEXT: For those short on CR or tuning units (tunits?), spamming low level events is a low energy way of converting energy into CR or tunits. Ep111 is popular because it's short (doable when you have little leftover energy), although lots of dialog bubbles to click through. Generic Upgrade1 has a short-ish path, no dialog, but I'm not sure if its layout is fixed to allow a recorded macro repeat until burned up your energy. Ep112 is especially good for those low on CR (doing lots of upgrades in a short time, which cost gt; 10000CR at a pop at higher levels). I don't know the true odds for Ep112 CR awards, but guessing half time 300CR, and somewhat more 200 than 400. Below the chart of the expected (long term average) value per unit of energy consumed for different autorace spamming options, based on your current Ep completion level. [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1uliYI-CDk5NIgJuuyzogk0N2oiKE6zMzyoxRBVAtmzM/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1uliYI-CDk5NIgJuuyzogk0N2oiKE6zMzyoxRBVAtmzM/edit?usp=sharing)

Thx I #8217;ve seen proponents of diff strategies so wanted to see the difference quantitatively. For sure I #8217;m in spam 112 mode. After every upgrade I don #8217;t have enough CR to tune other cars for a while.

Don't save too many though. If you get a new spotlight car (or say a McL) that you want to level up in a hurry, and you already dominated your generic upgrade event for the day, rather than wait another day just claim a few cards. As you get up in the middle upgrade levels you need 4x generic intakes at a pop, do you have time to dominate that event 2 days in a row? If not in a hurry sure the upgrade events are "free" for the expended energy, but if you need to get over some hump for dominating a spotlight and getting more draws, or more comfortable racing on McL, beating a story event etc, don't let a generic part shortage get in your way.

Different types of parts from the class upgrade events. The ones that they call class upgrade cards should be #8220;pro class #8221;. Class Exhaust, intake, brake you cannot get from these cards at all.

Just short of 1000g to guarantee a Senna. Knowing my luck, it will take 900g to get my first copy, then I #8217;ll get 3 Sennas in my next 10 free McL spins, and then be scrambling to complete and dominate story bits to rack up gold before the event expires, pull together 5 more spins, and get nothing more, just a very expensive 3.75* Senna to match my expensive 3.75* P1. #128541; Senna amp;P1 owners, how do you like them vs P1? I feel that in McL event matchups even when I overgas on my P1 launch I keep up with the AI Sennas OK. Maybe give up some in cornering and flat speed (P1 slips a bit in sharp corners)?

This, along with a Challenger Hellcat, two epics that I pulled in my non-guaranteed McL spins. Wonder if the epics (unlisted in the McL odds?) are the X factor that #8217;s driving the seemingly high miss rate on McL spins. If instead of 20% odds on McL it #8217;s 20% odds of either epic OR McL (say 10-10% or 5-15% split), no McL inside of 15-20 spins is much more likely. I wasn #8217;t really tracking that well whether it was in McL or spotlight, but it appears I have 2 challenger Hellcat copies, so maybe more disappointed in the lack of McLs than happy for an epic.

Bars looks like indicating needing 8 4\* dupes. If 5\* car is what's needed to finish Ep4 I'm just gonna quit and do the occasional Rivals or spotlight events to pick up rare/epics and do short boredom breaks during the day. My 904 is 4\* too but I like the Miura more (stuck at like 3.7\*). I'm hoping this spotlight dupes gets me more super classic spins to promote my Miura, although so far I've mainly gotten more 911 copies out of that. It's like the spin generator isn't really random and tilts against what you have upgraded. They obviously know what you have and upgraded, because they often start the spin on such a car, or finish ticking just past or just short of that on the animation. Maybe the spins truly are random and the visuals and tilted odds are just psychological perception, but the animation coding clearly knows what you have, so tilting against it in the spins would not be that hard to write in, you just wouldn't want to make it obvious enough that it couldn't possibly be just bad luck. That's my crackpot conspiracy theory for the day.

WRITING.TITLE: OK yay Senna on gold spin 2

What do you save your gold for? Your odds for a Senna from this weeks chips is no higher than for another epic McL (or more likely a 570s).

Isn't that the way things work though? I forgot how much I dropped to get an F1- not first gold draw but also not 8-10th. And then finally after a long long McL spin drought (and of course the guaranteed spins just getting 570s and 720s) my first non-guaranteed chip card McL at round 21 was another F1!

Haha. How many McLs did you get out of those 17 (aside from the guaranteed McL @ 5, 10,15?)? And are you at 14 non-guaranteed spins (level 17), or 17 (level 20)? That's why I'm thinking it's McL OR epic. If you count the non McL epics I didn't do so bad on my non-guaranteed spins (1 McL at level 21, and 2 epics in the prior 17 non-guaranteed McL spins). But from the point of getting McL's I did pretty bad (worst 2% of people assuming odds are right).
Lucky, looks like you #8217;re running low on gold #128540;

18 means your next spin completed card. You start on 1, having never spun. You are about having my bad streak as of that point. I think my Hellcat came round 16 but I was more mad about no McL than glad to get an epic then.

Right right there are the psyche games, but would/could they cook the actual odds is my conspiracy theory. Short of getting the source code, or large scale collaborative data collection, very hard to prove cooked odds. Defendants can write it off to small N stats/ random unluckiness. Sort of like that experiment opening 160 cards of challenge chips. 2, 3, 5, 20 people seeing gt;10% level 1 kits at Ep3 can be written off to random bad luck and biased self reporting (those who do badly more likely to report). But if gt;50% of the player base reports the same, THEN you have a case. But you have to have actual damages too (IRL $ spent because of the cooked odds). Lawyer fees would outweigh the $ spent in game for most players. And maybe unless you can prove malicious intent, even misadvertised odds is maybe no big deal - there #8217;s probably fine print in the agreement terms when starting the game.

Interesting that seems about the running odds, 5-6 paid spins per Senna. My mistake was chasing after a 4* P1 too early w/ not enough gold banked. After some early luck, 3 copies in 6 spins, 4 in 9, and then not enough gold for the double down offer(700g). none in the next 4, outta gold, scrambled to finish/dominate story for 2 more, then outta time to finish more story to earn more gold. If I had banked another 300g before my ninth spin, I could gotten my P1 to 4*. Ah well. Live and learn. Get the full gold stash ready before you start spinning

Yeah I guess rares are worst of both worlds w/r to Spotlight. Commons get the 30% per draw odds with lots of 2\*, Epics get only 10% odds (although still guaranteed 1 within 10), but rares are 10% odds to start AND half the time 2\*. Like I said stupid me coulda 4\* a charger RT with doubledown at 3.75\* but miscalculated, oh between my free spins I'll make rest of the week and remaining gold I can guarantee another in lt;400g... yeah, but 2\*!! Congrats at least on your purchased McLs. Your free spin luck resembles mine, and a lot of other peoples' based on the poll (all the 0 for 12s inside their first 15 free spins). Great that you had all that gold stashed. I started maybe 2nd week of mobile launch so nowhere near that much gold. Wasted (?) maybe 850g after my first week on spotlight for a guaranteed Boss 302, although it did give me a half decent array to start my garage. Wasted another 400g to get a 2\* ChargerRT on last day of its spotlight leaving me just short of 4. And then another 2100g or so for the 3 epic McLarens (only the P1 among them anywhere near 4\*).

Yep, that's why i called it conspiracy theory. Not easy to disprove, but easy to raise doubt/paranoia. I actually think most people are honest most of the time. Maybe 10% of the people honest 100% of the time. A huge block in the middle, 90% honest? But tempted with enough maybe willing to bend their morals. Don't casinos and such have very rigorous auditing systems from the regulators, you don't need to cook the odds that much to improve the cash flow. Of course casinos do much more volume than a little f2p mobile game so there's more at stake. But the more devious of humans are always weighing benefits of cheating against odds of getting caught.
I like +30 for rivals most of the time, I #8217;ve gotten burned maybe 20% of the time on some +40 matchups, at which point the losses offset the PI differential gains. 250 pts just for the win.

Yep, DD last turn if your car has double boost already mid last turn, once you are past 3/4 turn early gas outta there. Same deal if after the brake you #8217;re at lt;1.25 boost, even getting the additional half boost from perfect gas, not enough space to single boost and another near the line, even with a perfect gas. Gas out early to keep position and hope it #8217;s enough. Driving Focus I usually opt for other Focus, modern Skyline, Silvia, as Rivals opponent. MB Evolution II also sluggish. Early gas on DD 3 might also help if opp is passing on outside, because you swing wide, maybe squeeze their pass attempt. Don #8217;t gas before half turn because you #8217;ll hit a wall hard. One of the 111 races is DD so you can practice your freestyle driving there. Set opp to level 4 (matches your PI + 10-20). Bayside 1 similar choice- just missed perfect launch + perf brake = 2boosts ready mid turn. Finishing perfect turn has no benefit. Early gas outta there, but you sorta have to know how early for a given car. Some swing so far out that you lose ground. Most cars past 3/4 turn is safe enough. Bay2 and SB3 you can go pretty extreme though, being shallow turns gassing before mid turn is a hairy mess but you will gain ground on the opp or even pass w/o boosting. Practice in an early story level with your target track, opp set to matched higher PI.

Not delivered 4* of course, that would be a really great consolation prize #129316;. It was only a 2* but enough to push me over the missed hump spotlight week. As I kept pushing the Boss 302 upgrades, the Bayside landings started going sideways more- related to PI, or just devs tweaking the simulations? Plus Boss copies stalled at 3.5* for a while - the grand conSPINracy- So I #8217;m thinking devoting classic muscle upgrades to RT going forward. That way my next 5 premium/spotlight spins will be Boss 302s #128540;

Do you do a lot of spotlight? so much CR. You may still run out of CR before tunits though, as the upgrades needed to continue tuning suck up a lot of CR.

If you have windows or android you can set up/record a macro to do autorace grinding for you. Ep112 best for CR. Set it to loop number of times to chew up your nrg. If you record slow enough you can maybe do continuous loop. As long as it chews up lt;15nrg/hr conceivably could run indefinitely.

The last time I had trouble beating the 600pi senna in the McL event, my P1 was at 570. At 575. now 584, haven #8217;t lost once. On the launch even w/o using turbo the Sennas left way back. Yeah hard to say right? I guess I should be satisfied with buying the gold spins to get the McLs. I have each, only the P1 anywhere near 4*. Epics at least you have a shot at spotlight upgrading it, not McL tho.

Ok yeah I #8217;ve just loved the P1 from the start. Overgas starts no prob ahead of all but the top 5-10% launchers. When Senna won week 6 I was like what? In the McL event my P1 has lost to a senna like once, and until this week always punching up + gt;20

WRITING.TITLE: SUPERCAR! Winning ugly w/ P1 GTR

WRITING.TEXT: Practicing P1 launch spamming Ep112, dynamic difficulty (opp was like +11PI) about as ugly as it gets. Don #8217;t try this IRL kids #128563; DD turn 3 had double boost after brake, said let #8217;s see how early gas I can get away with... jumped curb, hit wall near utility box, near dead stop, AI car rounding turn. Hit the double boost for the win! Uh yeah. Not exactly realistic. Any way to videoclip on iOS? It #8217;d be great to be able to capture these crazy runs.

Hey I resemble that remark! Sometimes you take what the game gives you. Modern street no M3 till last week (2* , just barely 3* now). Only other modern streets gt;3.5* are C32 and E63. Both near 0 upgrades so lots of parts amp; CR to even get level w the 323ti. You think either of those appreciably better?

I would say. Just try not to boost late off that last turn. If it #8217;s going to be mid underpass before I have a double, I do a single boost and then another post jump. Not sure it helps but so far no catastrophes

Yeah a lot of my choices were first car to make it to 3*. Game seems to clump spins, not sure if by chance or by design. A car I don #8217;t have, then 3 in a row. First to 3* no correlation to first to 4*, quite annoying.

Lazy method is to spam Ep112. 300chips per card. All cards lvl3 tuning, half of them 300CR each. Remainder 200 or 400, at a 2:1 ratio guessing. If you dynamic race w/high level car, 5 cards. Lazy folks way autorace difficulty 3, 3 cards in 30 sec. Really lazy folks way if you can load it on windows or android, get a macro recorder to autorace super slowly (1 click every minute or 2). 7 units energy used, if you set it to loop super slowly (half hour each loop) you roughly burn at your nrg earn rate. you can go away do life stuff or nap, and come back to 6 challenge cards per hour away, and your nrg right where you left it at. #128564;

Gold every 4 hrs is only 10% odds? So maybe every 2 days if you do 4 per day? McL cards my first non guaranteed was on 21. Floating hypothesis: any of your McL cards to date a non McL epic? I pulled 2 in my dry streak. My luck has turned slightly more normal: 2 more McLs now at card 31 (so matching posted odds for my last 10)

Same on my guaranteed 570 2*,3*, 720 2*. My first free card was an F1 which I had already bought gold spin seeing how dismal my free spin odds were. Also bought the P1 early thinking it was like spotlight, car of the week higher odds... nope. I got my first on spin 2 then blew 1400g trying to 4* it... 3.75*, not enough g left to buy the double down offer. My luck #8220;turning #8221; only got me 2* 570, 720 but at least it #8217;s something. If lucky maybe I can 3* the 720 or 4* the P1 before the event is over... wishful thinking. Even the 3* P1 is amazing. People complain about the twitchy launch but if you can time it so that you mash and hold gas right as the shadow of the two countdown starts to show up you can nail the perfect start. I hit about half of those but even with overgas you are ahead of 90% of cars. The one time to take limited time offers? Double down to get a 3.75* rare car to 4*. Even in spotlight weeks most of the wins are 2* version of spotlight car. So a gold bought spotlight card may leave you short of 4*. Epic weeks though, every spotlight win is a 3*.
Congrats, your luck finally turned too

I think maybe a +50 vs an RS200, barely. But another time more recently I was taking on a +50ish one on SB, made it thru turn 3 ahead, double boosted, and it surged late, beat me by a half hood. Since then mostly stick to lt;40. The extra 100-200 points offset by the losses if you don #8217;t win gt;90%. A +30pi win is worth about 1000 pts, so you need 9 such big wins and a lot of new opp searching just to squeeze that last bit. For my RS200 amp; Focus RS I #8217;ll send them up against the same car +20ish. You don #8217;t know what track you #8217;ll get. Against pretty much anything else (ok maybe modern skyline too), w/ gt;20pi on SB you #8217;re scrod. Dunno if I #8220;want #8221; a modern skyline other than completionist OCD. I did pass on the GT40 though with a spin price of 140g! My 700g wouldn #8217;t guarantee a Senna so played it safe, and even after I won the Senna day 3 (knew I would get to 1000g by day 7, but was hoping P1 would be the last week), didn #8217;t get the GT40 based on how meh it is as a Rivals opponent.
That should be the new mode on a Tesla S P100D: Ludicrous Autorace!

How do you have so many brakes, I don #8217;t bother running that brake event since none of the upgrades have needed that so far. Generic upgrade I don #8217;t bother domination unless I need multiples of one of the parts, same in class upgrade likewise, or to pick up car spin card chips. Spotlight I just tried to dominate the level I could do without trouble (#2 when my cars were low 500s) and then if I had energy get as far as possible on # 3 down the lowest PI path. Then just quit event- you lose your challenge chips BFd but can keep the spotlight chips. Eventually you can win that easiest path, then eventually dominate as you get more high pi cars. McLaren is like having another spotlight event, 2000 chips, one card spin, if you can beat the 550 amp; 570 tier cars and all the class amp; era cars below (which should be easy as long as you don #8217;t send your top classic/retro/modern cars into their class race by accident ( did that once). The gold crates in McL are pretty lame #8220;2x lvl 4 tuning #8221; #8220;1500 CR #8221; so don #8217;t sweat the last races unless you can also beat the 590 amp; 600 McL car to dominate.

I have many of my upgraded cars stuck in the mid 500s waiting for the lucky spins to push them to 4*, and a bunch of 4* with 0 upgrades. No sorry I don #8217;t want another Silvia K Aero (that #8217;s what I got from my 3* card yesterday)

WRITING.TITLE: The drama... what car will I win?

WRITING.TEXT: #128514;I think I need to just keep on pulling these from the upgrade events as much as possible, before they open up the retro episode. At that point betcha they add another retro muscle car or 2 and then the draws will get diluted, and the chance of getting 5* gets draaaaaawwwnnn out. Of course then the other retro muscle they release will be epic and pound the Cobra R to dust...
Other than feeling, #8220;Darn, just missed the 3* copy #8221; at least spared the agony of feeling all your less preferred cars in the class/era are getting way ahead in star rating ;)
Someone on the race database sheet has a few PI 800 cars! I #8217;m guessing started the windows version long ago.
Cobras at least an Ok ish car I feel. Imagine the disappointment of getting a Silvia K from a 3* card, a car I like to pick on in Rivals.

So what #8217;d your final garage look like? On the racing aspect, I #8217;ve gone the freestyle route just for spice and experimentation. Sometimes it #8217;s detrimental to getting a win but it #8217;s interesting. Especially DD even when outclassed, on the turns you can get close enough to wreak havoc. I had done perfect start and boost just to keep up to turn 1 so I no braked and rode it into the cafe wall. It escaped and pulled away for the win. Same on turn 3 DD, op got through first and even perfect gas wouldn #8217;t be anywhere near double boost so I early gassed since I was on corner inside, and pushed it up the curb and everyone went all akimbo. One time I won, another time lost. Maybe the outcomes would #8217;ve been same w/o playing bumper cars, but it was fun pushing the edge. After story completion and with garage mostly complete, I can see there not being much point tho. I too was a little bored w/ the race mechanics until discovering freestyle over trying to perfect every turn. Started trying out NFS no limits, didn #8217;t really get into it nor understand the constructs for story progress amp; upgrades . Gritty tone may work for some but not really for me. A9 is lighter (all daytime?) and kinda chaotic based on the preview clips. Is the progress upgrade path equally convoluted as NFS. I guess FS upgrades are pretty convoluted too until you get used to it

At the least once you hit 3* or 4* you should be able to get diff colors. #8220;No your choices are red only. But you can choose this nice camo pattern or triangles!! #8221; Come on. At least give us non factory base coat colors. I know it adds computational overhead to make fully customized paint jobs, but the base color change should be easy peasy.
I wonder if there #8217;s any one out there w/ a 650+pi RS200.

Definitely, freestyle for me started with DD 2 where if opp is close the double boost is wasted but hold it and they blast to turn 3 way too far ahead to catch up. Screw the perfect gas, you #8217;re worse off. Then reports of no-lift and Half braking on bay2 amp; SB 3 opened up the floodgates of experimentation for me, as I started to beat +25-30 upgrade/spotlight/etc that I was failing trying to race clean. Used it on McL sometimes too. If it looks like you #8217;re gonna lose anyway give it a shot. On Bay 2 sometimes you love tap em and they stay about even, but other times you ride the inside or outside curb yet pull ahead. My fave time was shoving the opp on the outside line into the curb. Obviously you beat the story already so nothing you really need to do further, but for a bit of entertainment try for what you can get away with, whether it helps or hurts.
Good to see gt;40pi can still be done. I #8217;ve done it a few times but to sloppy a driver and too impatient to get best matchups. How close were the times, and this is Bayside?
Wow that is an exercise in futility. Your supposed odds of that happening- 0.8^29
Wow that is an exercise in futility. Your supposed odds of that happening- 0.8^29 that #8217;s 0.15%. 1 in 600 people!!

WRITING.TITLE: Waiting for the SpinOMatic - garage at 2 months

WRITING.TEXT: Probably where a lot of people who started around the time of mobile launch are currently. Waiting for the wheel of fortune to spin their preferred/ upgraded cars into 4* zone to get above 570ish PI. Switching allegiances bottlenecked by class upgrade frequency. Wasted lots of efforts/upgrades on Camaro 35th until they turned it into a skater on Bayside landings. Probably spent too much gold on P1 to get it to just 3.75*, and effort getting McLs upgraded to win McL events, altho they #8217;re still useful in spotlight 3, class upgrade 2, etc. But a dead end for story til next year given super low McL card drop rates personally.
Btw noticed the dupes progress bar is wrong on initial viewing when you show by class, but click on a car you know shows wrong, then back out, and it will show correct bar status.

Leaning towards Miura, altho in super classic spins feels like a sea of silver 904s blowing by but we know the animation display and underlying odds may not be correlated. It took longer for Miura to 4*, but when they were both 478pi Miura was nearly always 1 sec faster on SB. 904 might be a shade easier on DD, maybe compensatable by trying to better focus driver error. Trying to get Charger Hellcat to 4* in spotlight, but it #8217;s way behind on upgrades too. More pep/fun to drive than Mustang GT, but class parts are slow to come. My 2008 M3 is sadly still only 2 copies of 2*. Spin gods dealt me lots of 323ti early, but they take the away too by stalling me out at 3.9* like forever.

In the early layout you couldn #8217;t touch half the board w/o a preexisting McL or a super high pi era car. I got my P1 knowing without any existing McL, collecting chips would be slow. The Existing format is better for entry, you should be able to squeeze out 500 chips a day, so a spin every 3-4 days even if you have cars ~500pi only. After a cold streak to card 21, I finally hit (F1, which I had already gotten w/ gold spins), although on the way my non guaranteed included 2 challenger hellcats. Now at card 36, I have since picked up 2 2* 570s, and 1 2* 720s. amp; 1 Lamborghini Aventador. So close to posted odds if you only count the recent streak.

Yeah, somehow the game opp isn #8217;t yellow that often so I went that route. Early on I would sometime brake when the other car would hit the brake zone, usually not a good result #128517; I will maybe have to get my non McL supers up eventually since they #8217;ll be stuck at 585pi til next year. Maybe 585 is enough for moderns on ep 3. And lots of wrong turns as they tweaked some cars worse on Bayside jumps, waiting for dupes that are slow to come until you start leveling up your other car. It #8217;s like the spin AI knows what you want, and cuts those odds #128540;

Yeah on Bay 2 the outcome of an early gas is a little unpredictable, but if you get the inside line it #8217;s nice revenge for the bump you often get at turn 1 when you #8217;re outside. On turn 2 most of the time you just hop the curb for a pass but a few times I pushed the AI car into the outer curb. Sometimes you glance off their left rear bumper and end up on the outer curb yourself, but I would say 80-90% of the time you gain ground/pass by early gassing.

WRITING.TITLE: Is Rivals recorded ghost runs?
WRITING.TEXT: Some of the names seem similar/identical to users on this reddit. Are they just borrowing names, or using actual past runs as ghost racers for the AI car?
Rs200, the sports car everyone likes to pick on. It was close though, I had to purposely early gas Bayside turn 2, if I had missed 1-2 of the other perfects mighta lost this one.

Who to send your RS200 up against? Another RS200 of course. Thankfully didn #8217;t lose track and attempt to brake or gas the other car this time #128517; I think they #8217;ve buffed it a bit for sure, couple times on SB it #8217;s blown by me in the homestretch when I sat in the lead with only a single boost ready.

Nice. Jealous of your 4* McLs. Free spins, or how many gold spins in total to get there? And on the gold spins, do they ever drop a McL different than the featured car (I expect not). My P1 is the only one at 3.75 star, but I assume a gold Senna spin will never drop a P1.

Not lucky, patient. Pick new opponent, repeatedly. Then switch your car to a lower PI one with a gap you can win. Also doh, start on your lowest tier cars first. Pick a car say +10-20 pi higher than your lowest remaining cars. Just realized that yesterday as I used one of my tweener cars on a race and the gap was too big on the rest of my fleet. Rivals defaults to start w/ your highest PI car.
Most of the opponents drawn will be -9 to +19, with the majority in the 0 to +10 range.
But there are weaker ones within any group if you #8217;re not trying to squeeze out every last point. Sometimes I #8217;ll just take a +15-19 of same car just to be done with it.
Yeah, if you can handle +30-40 pi that would be a good gap
#128077; just remember that a generic win is often ~800pts so squeezing an extra 100-200pts may lead to losses = 0pts
#128077; just remember that a generic win is often ~800pts so squeezing an extra 100-200pts may lead to losses = 0pts

The turbo 2002 i have at 570pi and don #8217;t think I ever get lt;44sec times on bayside. Any tips on when to boost? If I get perfect start I do single boost immediately since I hate getting crowded at turn 1, another single halfway down hill, double boost right after turn 3. If opp is fast launcher I #8217;ll double boost right after turn 1 (since I #8217;m behind amp; not crowded/pushed wide), then double boost right after turn 3.

Wow, jealous, How do you get F1 P1 amp;Senna all to 4*? Extreme luck or stockpiled gold? If the posted odds are anywhere near right it would take ~2000-2500g of gold spins for each assuming averageish luck. McL event even longer odds.

Yeah on the 300sl you have to double boost pretty much as soon as you straighten from turn 3, if you can. If I #8217;m gonna have double mid underpass I can never decide between early single + post jump single or just double rocket and hope you don #8217;t flip out.

Last day of McL event, 865g burning a hole in my pocket... what am I saving it for? 6 shots at a GT40? Card 41 McL event this morn, a dupe of my Senna drops, 3.25* now. Gold spin 2 no dice- now i can #8217;t buy the double down even if offered. #3 BINGO. Come on 4. Bzzt. WTF I #8217;m all in let #8217;s go.., #5 DING DING. Double down offer.. I said I was gambling so screw that. 3 spins left, hold, close my eyes, breathe, HOLY }% gt;^^ #8217; OF ALL CREATION!!! I guess the McL card Senna dupe this morn amp; this kinda make up for the 18 free McL card losing streak. and the 3.75* P1 tantalizingly just out of reach (spin 5 and no more gold). I #8217;d rather a 4* P1 but don #8217;t look a gift horse...

Some of the grind (story advancement) gets you gold, 20g from each event domination, 50g per part. 100g per episode. But obviously cash money gets you way further faster. You can beat this game without a single McL or other epic, so I think a lot of it is Pokemon #8220;Gotta get em all #8221; collectors OCD.

I so wished that too. The P1 was even with Senna in the early part of the Reddit poll so I was hoping, perhaps I shoulda done more hyping on the Facebook poll. Even before I got good at the mash pedal when 2 countdown shows technique, the insane launch even w/ overgas made up for a lot of ineptitude on the driver #8217;s part. Neither the greatest speed nor greatest cornering. But combined qualities better than my other top epic car, a Z06, until I got that gt; 20pi higher and I could just autorace a given matchup.

I so wished that too. The P1 was even with Senna in the early part of the Reddit poll so I was hoping, perhaps I shoulda done more hyping on the Facebook poll. Even before I got good at the mash pedal when 2 countdown shows technique, the insane launch even w/ overgas made up for a lot of ineptitude on the driver #8217;s part. WRITING.TITLE: Final McLaren card tallies
WRITING.TEXT: Aside from the guaranteed cards 5/10/15th, what % McLs did you get total? [View Poll](https://www.reddit.com/poll/hukg1t)

I think the stats so far bear out the gripes many had of the low drop rate of McLs in the event cards. But at least some now appear winnable in regular class or spotlight cards? even if the odds are low as typical for epics.
Yeah thats great it #8217;s winnable outside the American Classics event layout, is a pain to figure out
Every row has 2 classes, 2 eras, one brand and one American. So the only way to finish a line is to use 2 American cars or burn wrenches

GT40 is pretty bad. I got beaten barely by a Bel air at +15 but I also drove badly that run. GT40 +30 I think I would be close win that run. Super Sports are pretty meh, I drove one against another SS at +30 and beat it easily with a #8220;good #8221; run
BTW how #8217;s it drive?

Yep. That middle line is the hardest. Modern/classic Super/sports Chevy/American The only American supers are Ford GT amp; GT40. GT w Chevy classic sports = ZR1 or Stingray. GT40 w Chevy Z06 You #8217;ll need to get that ZR1 much higher tho. 3 tries with 490pi ZR1 I couldn #8217;t beat the 500pi classic Skyline. I just gave up that line for the day Bottom line Modern/classic Muscle/street Dodge/American Dodge Modern muscle - Either Hellcat American Classic street - Ford Capri or Escort (classic) No other American street ... well I guess bel air now Top line Retro /Classic Sports /muscle Ford /American So Ford retro cobra R. W/ Chevy ZR1 or stingray Or Ford RS200. W/ Lots of classic american muscle to choose from

Which one is easier to beat in rivals or story? There #8217;s s certain psyche out factor in quick launchers which makes for sloppy racing on a humans part. But assuming you #8217;re reasonably collected. What are the +pi. differentials for each you think an averagish driver (half perfects usually) could manage?

I #8217;m practicing not following the brake/gas zones religiously. On some cars it helps, others it hurts. Most of the Lamborghini amp; McL F1 seem to slide a huge amount if you early gas by more than a half nose. Focus Rs the opposite, its double boost is so lame that on SB3 and Bay2 you might be better off doing no brake or a touch amp;go to get a partial boost w/o losing too much speed. I only pretty much use my Focus for rivals and mostly run it vs another focus around +20-30pi so haven #8217;t really worked out a #8220;best #8221; way to drive it for each track. So I wonder if the AI knows those tricks and what it can swing for each car. I used to wonder on Bay 2 how the AI blew past me (after I did a double perfect) and yet had a double boost ready for turn 3; now I return the favor when I can. Still learning the ropes tho; sometimes I scrape too much curb/wall and lose anyway. But it can be a good desperation move.

Yeah had I known that they would switch it to a regular card you could pull year round I wouldn #8217;t have paid gold in the last days of the McL when I hit 3.75* to double down it. I #8217;ve since gotten one more 2* dupe. Sadly my 720s is still stuck at 2.75*. But happy I will eventually maybe get my P1 from 3.75* up to 4*.
Ok yah. GT is so slow on the straights I #8217;d worry the track pull would be SB if up against nearly any other car. At least against same car you know AI will be similarly sluggish.

Yep. Just always do the muscle upgrade event. Look at the layout map, see those chips that say retro? Just gotta beat the cars on that path. Should be able to do it not too long after starting to play. you just need a classic And modern muscle in the mid 400pi range.
Is a F1 worse than a modern skyline or GT40 among epics? Unfortunately I have no 918 so the most I #8217;ve done (successfully) is +40ish.

F1 is real slidey on turns so DD not its forte, but good enough to beat a Skyline II... just shy of 2k... Every time I try for +50pi though I get burned- dunno if it #8217;s the pressure or just less margin for error. On this matchup though probably coulda swung a +45-48pi

Haven #8217;t explored taking on a Viper yet. What #8217;s its main weakness? top speed? I tried +15 vs a Centenario given how much people complain about its performance and got burned (drove kinda badly then too). Beat a +25 Centenario in upgrade using a Senna, maybe w/o the one amp; done pressure of rivals driving clean is easier.

Gradually learning the timing for blind gassing, consider it a win if I can squeeze at least a great gas out on those. Find it help if I say out loud ...aannd bing when I can see and use the same cadence when I can #8217;t see.

Yeah countach is kinda a slug, used to be my highest retro super until I got F1. For all the F1s faults doesn #8217;t seem worth upgrading the countach to high 500s. My Diablo is sadly 3.2* so no other good retro super options?

Start from your 2nd lowest Pi tier. then switch in one of your lowest tier cars when you see a matchup you like. I used to start from Top down but then ended up with big Pi gaps that the lower cars could never manage (eg 50pi)

It #8217;s still possible to do stuff like this but the window is tighter. I spun around an AI Charger Rt by double boosting into its rear bumper exiting Bay3. Rode 2 AI cars into the wall at DD3 by early gassing, won once, lost once. DD3 another time from behind amp; outside I early gassed up the curb and double boosted past AI. Another time went way too early and bounced off wall to a near dead stop. Bay2 early gas I once rode AI car into the curb for an easy pass and win. Another time hit a Centarino square on rear bumper and billiard shotted it into a huge lead while I lost all momentum. So there is fun to be had still. Generally knowing your car vs AI cornering ability helps.

The brake zone has that handy chittering in the lead up to the perfect bar. Would be handy if the lead in to gas has a similar but different sound, maybe low tone- wubububub , then you could drive blindfolded

Are you in a hurry to finish or are you just along for the ride? I sat on a Miura at 3.7* for like 2 weeks waiting for it to 4* after my 904 did. Miura a whole sec faster on SB for me when at the same PI. But it takes the corners slower/ w more sliding in DD. In Bayside prob a draw. If you got time, stick w/ what you like, spotlight will likely come around to all again (tho diablo was not that long ago, may take a while to cycle around). Countach is very meh overall.
My poor stingray is at 2.75*. Even w/ a spotlight, not great odds of getting it 4*. But at least some sports classic dupes will get me spins to get my 300sl up to 4*

BTW if you #8217;re on car class view and want to see your star progression bar on all those cars, click to view one car, then back up to the whole class view, and magically all your bars will show. Obviously a display bug.

WRITING.TITLE: Which missing Epic is worth having?

WRITING.TEXT: Other than for OCD completionism?

Interesting, it #8217;s pretty easy to beat in Rivals. The AI driver does various stupid things like boost 5 car lengths from the next turn and such. But in regular usage in story/upgrade/spotlight, is it half decent at taking on +25pi cars? I really love the McL P1. Tho mine is stuck at 3.75* 585pi it feels the equal of my z06 at 610pi (other than not being able to autorace cars in the high 500s). The launch if you can time right is insane. But even a too much gas you #8217;re off the line faster than all but the top 5% of cars in Forza Street.

Sounds a lot like the modern GT, pretty smooth, a bit sedate. When not too much is at stake learn how to drive imperfect tho with various cars. With some cars you lose more waiting for your perfect gas than you would get from the extra half boost. Also practice catching a great or perfect gas after a late brake, it comes handy for missed turns. Some turns (Bay2, SB3) with some cars you can get away with very late brake and/or very early gas w/o crashing. Some cars (focus RS, other street cars) the double boost is so anemic some people do a no lift on those wide turns and hold max speed better. Check your lap times to see whether it helps or hurts much. I find early gassing so much fun, the results are a bit unpredictable, but riding up on the sidewalk for an inside or outside pass, or pushing the opp up into the curb is sadistically satisfying and a lot less boring than monotonically trying to nail perfect everythings #128520;

WRITING.TITLE: Who #8217;s afraid of a little Spyder?

WRITING.TEXT: The image is a little deceiving, the PI difference I don #8217;t think would be +42? I set level 4 difficulty on the last exhaust upgrade super path race... at most +20? Far from a clean run for me, but by turn 2 I was well ahead. 918 has a great launch but meh top end

3 hrs prior Day 4 was locked for me, now it shows 1 hr to go! Anyone else see similar thing? Thankfully I had enough energy saved to autorace through it but they really have this all messed up. Day 1 I started with it showing 4hrs to go, and then blam day 2 starts before I build up energy to finish. Days 2 amp; 3 I start earlier knowing the 3 hr error, but all day today Day 4 shows as locked until i looked again just 10 min ago. So so so so totally messed up, they don #8217;t have their act together at all on this event.

Yeah I #8217;m too sloppy, I need a really bad opponent or a really good car or both to pull a 40+ regularly. Mid to high 30s safer, but I #8217;ve lost a couple even vs +30pi with a late brake or early gas or 2 at bad times (eg Bay3 or DD3 short a double boost, SB3 missing the half boost, or trying for the double perfect while opp super is close behind and blows right by). And some cars no lead feels safe. ZR1. RS200. Focus. Silvia. 914. What cars do you take the smallest differential?

Right but what do you do when one of those is YOUR car. I think from now on I #8217;m going to have to do those as twin matchups, because it #8217;s hard to anticipate relative strengths and weaknesses. I had a big lead w/ an Rs200 over a GT @ DD but couldn #8217;t decide whether to early gas turn 3 or not. Opted not, to get a half boost, halfway down the stretch as GT rounds the turn, come on come on, and I don #8217;t know if it was a single or double, but the GT had enough boost to blow by 7/8 down the stretch. There #8217;s no look back button so hard to judge what to do with the lead in a slow car. Maybe just act like you #8217;re already behind, screw the extra perfect points and get the win, however ugly.

Yeah you need one leader to get through the class upgrade event which gets you more spins and upgrade parts for itself and others of the class. I got a Z06 about 3 weeks in and sports became the category w/ the most high PI cars for me. Super was OK, the mobile launch month free GT is good enough most of the time in the early going. But muscle modern amp; classic both lacking until recently.

iOS, iphone Xr. It feels like it #8217;s mostly related to local operations on the device. If I have apps w/ background notification, FS hiccups right before the notifications show, and some of the more obtrusive ones, like incoming calls I haven #8217;t totally figured out- the game goes on pause but when I return, finger on the pedal location, it registers as gas off/brake on when I unpause. One time I realized and reacted pretty fast but had already braked/lost momentum and opp blew past. The other thing is when power gets low it does a lot of lag/jump. I #8217;ve lost a few races I had well in hand that way too.

I was going to try to see if I could side load that way. Dunno if it #8217;s some kind of hardware incompatibility with Moto in general . X pure has 3gb ram, android 7.0. Which in theory should be enough. I generally like Moto devices, but if even the newer ones can #8217;t run Forza Street, may have to consider other brands.
Yah I ran that one double after turn 1, single after 2, single after 3. Not enough vs the GT.
Anyone else see a random glitch on DD2 where the brake zone is all just compressed in the perfect bar? Happens to me maybe 10% of the time on DD.

I think step 1 would should be vs ghosts from previous rivals runs, cursory method take the checkpoint times amp; finish times from prior runs of real players with given car/PI range and squeeze the animation to match. Maybe do some computer model time expansion or shrinkage, eg if no real player ever bothered to level up a 780pi Skyline II, extrapolate the seconds/100pi change on the tracks to give it the x% improvement in lap time expected. Then you don #8217;t have to rely on a pool of players to be online any given moment. Just feed the game checkpoint times and let it simulate locally. Right now #8220;practice #8221; is Ep112 on dynamic difficulty for me. Rack up challenge cards while trying out car handling amp; techniques.
no guarantees your next spins won #8217;t be 2* or duds. This is like 3x2* wins for 400G guaranteed versus paying 425G for five spins with no guarantee.
Congrats, you are a serious gambler. 8% odds for 800G. If I was that committed to getting the GT40 the prior event with 140G spins for 10%? odds would be better.

I learned last time with Charger RT, 3.75 at day 4, how can I not get another (I could get 2 spotlight cards/day at that point), plus w/ 400g I #8217;m guaranteed at least one. Uh yeah, forgetting that 3/4 of them are 2*. So I got one 2* copy for the price of a double down, DOH! I think the spin algorithm analyzes what it appears you want and then gives it to you in flurries AFTER. Maybe a server issue? If you have Xbox center installed on Win10 have you tried logging out and in as another account, then starting game? If That hangs too probably a general service problem, vs corrupted account data.

I like the 2002 turbo too, although it happened to be well ahead of escort in the star sweepstakes from 3* all the way thru 4*. Less than 0.2 sec is nothing in the scheme of things but even if you get ~same times, if you get stressed on runs with a given car, best to level up another. For me in super my Miura runs were averaging a full second faster on SB than the 904, so I had to wait ~2weeks longer for it to 4*. Just when I was getting tired of waiting and pushed the 904 to 530pi to better run the upgrade events, the Miura got its 4*. Always works out that way huh?

Yeah I like Miura. 904 holds corners better but lacking in speed. Cobra R is def the best retro muscle out there! Ok yeah I like to run against it in Rivals, but if you just want something with Uber high PI to autorace with, it should be your first to 5*.
