Never spun anyone on Bay1, I guess you have to be lagging/ TMG or slow start? Was it a tight turning car vs a classic muscle, where it swung wide in front of you? I wish I had a clip of the time on DD where I jammed my Turbo2002 under the butt of a Cuda and shoved it 2/3 of the way down leg 3. I was just cracking up while it was happening. I thought for sure it would finish with the Cuda spun around but it just dropped back down and won the race (I having burned my double boost). Still, totally amusing that they would build that into the coding.

Depends on your driving style. Huracan might be a shade faster on straights, and pretty easy to perfect launch. But finishing turns takes forever, and it doesn't like early gas much. GTR already 3\*. It might take you 1 week or 1 month or longer to get your Huracan 3\* (your best chance was the spotlight a few weeks back). Total luck of the draw. GTR has a very twitchy launch, not easy to get a lot of perfects. But decent launch speed even if only in good zone. Holds turns really well and pretty fast, though not the fastest on straights. I'd go with the GTR, since it's already 3\*, and because those slo mo turns in the Huracan and many other Lambos (aside from the Miura) are pretty annoying to me. If I were racing myself head to head these 2 at same PI, I think I would win in the GTR on DD and Bay, in the Huracan on SB.
Congrats. Yep it takes a darn lotta CR to get a car that high.
Yep. Used to worry about maximizing tuning units ( rushing to get to Ep3), but at every level turns out you earn those faster than CR

Even when you get Senna or P1, so far never been a McLaren spotlight, only the 1x per year McLaren spotlight (~Jun). They can get to 585pi vs 575 for rares, but may get stuck at 3* til next Jun. At which point your GTR is likely long into 4* range with higher max PI. Epics are good as the 3rd filler car for unrestricted races in story or upgrade (when you choose a path with 7-8 races), but even tho some like P1 amp; Senna do well above their PI, a 4* upgraded to auto race nearly everything is a surer bet than manually winning every single race in a 9race path.

WRITING.TITLE: Do "Bad" cars do better at high PI (or "Great" cars less great)?
WRITING.TEXT: Forza Street Rivals took on a GT40 662PI with my P1 613PI, ended up on Bayside. Perfect launch, perfect brake, great gas, and on the lookback the GT40 is right on my tail! Double boost down, perfect brake, early gas (maybe 2/3 through turn 2) knowing that a P1 has decent but not very top max speed vs GT40 which is very fast but slow starter. That it was right on my tail after turn 1 was worrying (why I early gassed 2). Perfect brake, perfect gas turn 3, look back it's maybe 2 lengths back (too close for comfort), hit my double boost, it hits its boost a second from the ramp (at which point it's right on my bumper and I know the race is lost), passed on the landing, YOU LOSE. Maybe I just bit off more than I could chew (+49PI), but not sure how I could have done better. Early gas out of turn 1 for more gap? Very early gas turn 2 (1/2 way vs 2/3?) Early gas 3 for more gap and later double boost, or late brake 3 to hit the turn sooner? Anyway as I push my cars to higher PI I generally feel there's smaller margins to mess up in Rivals. Is this a general tendency, e.g. some cars (e.g. Epics) look spectacular in the 3\* zone (low 500s up to 585pi), but once you're above 600 there's some flattening of the differential? I notice a lot of comments about the Centenario being a horrible car but so far in using mine (taken up to 510pi) it was smashing the Rivals AI car (usually taking on a GT40 or SkylineII, with a +40-45PI differential) by more than even my Senna or P1 could currently. But it's been a while since those were in the low 500s in PI, and back there those had seemed near invincible too.

You can spend gold from story or rivals or the every 4 hr check-in, which directly gives CR (500 1200 or 2200) or 10g which you can in turn use to buy CR via the spin pack (40g for one spin, min 10k CR, max 30k). The 5 spin pack is ever so slightly cheaper at 190g. The other thing I do is spam Ep 112 either auto-race level3 or manually level 4, depending on whether I have more game energy, or attention span. Yes that gets you more tuning kits too, but the imbalance is the smallest possible (~300CR for 400 tunits) (I #8217;m assuming you already hit up generic upgrade and spotlight for the scattered CR. and event finish or domination CR)

Right, but if you do story at all after domination just do Ep 112, only 300 chips per card, 3 races at max = 5 cards, yield ~1500CR for 7 energy. Or at autorace lvl3, = 3 cards, ~900CR. The tuning kits are all 400 unit, but the CR from the cards are random 200-400, but mostly average 300.

Right but it #8217;s not like they #8217;ll ever give you gold for CR. So let #8217;s call 4M enough for 40 upgrades of 100k CR each. Do you have that many backlogged, and won #8217;t you have even more CR by then ( so might as well use some of the generics to speed up upgrade rate?). To me only makes sense to wait if something else is rate limiting as well. (E.g. short on suspensions, don #8217;t tune up to the upgrade PI until you get the parts, or need to beat/autorace an event node). By the time the parts are ready you might have or not, enough class tuners to get to the upgrade PI. If the parts are ready, I #8217;ll often just use generic tuners to fill up to the upgrade Pi rather than wait to the next class event to get class specific tunes.

Yeah, the carousel is fake. Once you committed to the spin the card is gone, the car is won. I once got an Xbox achievement alert the instant I started a spin, and voila, new epic car, next garage level, etc. I think once you even see the hold button to start the spin you #8217;ve passed the point of return. Never experimented to quit game by killing the window at that point. But bet it #8217;s still card gone car won. What you may have stumbled on is the tip off on what new car you won, before the spin animation.
Wonder if the AI ever wins a tie. I #8217;m guessing not, by default user always wins.

New car so wasn #8217;t sure if I would regret it, taking on the unknown ALFA in Rivals. GT on the slow side, but in a slow launch session, so took it on at +37pi. Managed a perfect launch and seeing the Zagato shrink in the rear view, looked promising. No late bursts of speed from the Zagato. Easy win. Seems to follow the pattern of slow retros game wide.

Bayside, so maybe not enough room to build up a head of steam? Anyway it was so far back on the downhill I tried for double perfect on 2, but since I was full double boost before gas zone on 3 decided to slightly early gas out rather than wait for trouble since the GT is slowish. I was almost to the ramp before it showed rounding turn 3 so I knew I was safely home. Also the margins for wins shrink at higher PI so my win at 586 PI easier than +37PI in the mid 600s Anyway, on SB I really try for 2-1-2 on my boosts, or 2-1-11 micro braking turn 3 if AI close. Only 1-2-1 if I can #8217;t swing 2 outta 3 perfects on opening launch/brake/gas. Those late bursts on SB kill you, Focus and RS200 have blown by me in poorly run races where I thought I was safe- feels like a double out of turn 3 or enough for a single single combo in the stretch is a minimum to hold off those late surges. The AI level seems non- linear. In the 500s +40 is easy, +45 is kinda tough, and +50 it sorta declares you have no business beating even a Focus/RS200 if you messed up a turn.

Just do vs +19pi max and nail all the turns - 2 of 3 perfects on launch brake gas for turn 1, double boost leg 2 ASAP (also possible with good/great/great), single boost the long straight leg 3, and micro brake turn 3- double boost if ready within the first quarter of homestretch, else single single the final straight. If you have the patience wait for another Focus as opponent, win vs +30pi should be possible with that too.

Redemption is 1 spin per 5000 as class era (they stay classic super) vs per 2000 as spotlight. Vs about 1.25 spins of those 6000 chips converted to generic class-era. Spotlight actually gives more opportunity for other classes and eras than do the converted chips.
